comments:
Version: 3.2.0
Build id: I20060413-1718

While browsing the Callisto update site i got the attached exception.  Update is passing null into getChecked, but this should probably not cause a null pointer exception.

To reproduce:
1. Open the install/update wizard
2. Select the callisto update site
3. Under java, select the visual editor (this should cause an error to be displayed)
4. Attempt to open the modelling category to select EMF
5. Observe: An error dialog should pop up and an empty tree element will show up at the bottom of the category.

This is reproducable with various sets of steps in 3.2RC7.  I don't see it when using the Callisto Discovery Site, but any mirror causes the error.
David, I am cc you this bug since there seem to be some problems with replication of Callisto. However, update should be more graceful about this. I will look into update part of the story.

I'm not sure this is a mirror issue, unless its just that some are slower. 

The little I've checked, the files seem there, and could be downloaded if just the one, main box checked. The problem shows up if some branch is expanced, then its parent node is turned off/on. I think its a threading problem?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 148675 ***
